reviews.review: If you are reading this review and haven't played this game by now i have to say.. I'm disappointed in you.
Best single player game ever made

Has an ending better than Game Of Thrones.
Wie immer eine Freude Bioshock zu spielen. Nach all den Jahren habe ich es in den letzten Tagen noch einmal angeworfen und prompt erneut durchgespielt. Was man nicht alles noch so findet... :)
I originally played this back on the ps3 and loved it. Being able to go through the game again on steam makes me excited for sure. Still as fun as I remember
The whole BioShock series is pure gold.

Been hearing about this game for years now, bought it on sale about a year ago and have finally got round to playing it. 3 hours in and I can honestly say it lives up to all the things people say. The setting is captivating from the get go and I am very excited to see where the story goes.
fun game with great story. played it multiple times on xbox
weird as fuck, but really fun. Shooting actually feels SUPER good, and the powers or whatever they're called are good. No fucking clue what happened in the story, but I liked it.
One of my favorite games. The key to really enjoying this game is never once knowing what it could've been..But even then it's still a good game with great dlc!

After playing this one for 8 hours, i can now say this is my favorite bioshock game, You know a lot of games dont bother to reverse the story on players. I knew how the game ended but i just wanted to see how it was played out, and to my surprise it was played out perfectly. i highly recommend this game. 10/10

BioShock: Infinite is a marvelous masterpiece, a must have, it's so different to the first Bioshock, yet so similar at the same time. 

Everything about this game just makes sense. It offers a beautiful world, a good balance between action, exploration and story. And my GOD, what a story! Do yourself a favor and get this game as soon as you can.

Best. Game. Ever.
Massive replayability, haunting storyline, nuanced music and artwork. Somebody please put a copy of this in that Norwegian Seed Bunker for the future to experience this absolute fucking gem.
un grandisimo juego lo recomiendo muchisimo si te gustan los shooters, tiene una historia muy buena.
Top 5 for me. The detail, story, combat mechanics and overall feel of the game are just top notch. It was a complete package I wasn't expecting.

This game is a ton of fun to play. The melee weapon and the shooting feels really good. You get to swing around on rails and drop onto enemies. I encountered only 1 minor bug. Unfortunately you can no longer hack instead you have someone lockpick for you.  The plasmids I think are a step down from previous games. The ending was just absolutely terrible. I played on hard and it was easier than bioshock 1 which I played on normal except the mr handys and the ghost dont die. Although being the only challenge they are just irritating to fight. This game is nothing like Bioshock 1 and 2 but is worth playing anyways because I though it was still pretty good.

Nachdem ich das Grundspiel und seine VorgÃ¤nger nun abgeschlossen habe und vor dem DLC Burial at Sea stehe, will ich mein Erlebnis mit der Reihe festhalten, daher SPOILERWARNUNG!

0. Elizabeth ist meiner Meinung nach einer der besten Charaktere der Videospielgeschichte.
Sie ist sowohl eine Hilfe im Kampf, indem sie den Spieler mit Munition und Heilung versorgt als auch eine tolle Begleitung beim Erkunden, da sie immer wieder Dialoge anfÃ¤ngt und so die Welt richtig einbezieht. AuÃŸerdem kann sie durch ihre FÃ¤higkeit die Map zum Vorteil des Spielers verÃ¤ndern.
Wen die Entwicklung interessiert: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hSDDE3ICLhA

1. Man wird ohne groÃŸe ErklÃ¤rung in die Welt geworfen und verfolgt die Mission "Das MÃ¤dchen zurÃ¼ckholen". Die Story wird nach und nach entfalten, um dann mit einem maximalen Mindfuck und einem offenen Ende zu schlieÃŸen. Die Spekulation hier fand ich sehr interessant: 
https://www.ign.com/wikis/bioshock-infinite/The_Ending_-_An_Explanation

2. Anfangs Wechsel zwischen gemÃ¼tlichem Erkunden und Action; Man findet schnell in die Welt hinein

3. Vergleich zu den VorgÃ¤ngern: 
Das Gunplay funktioniert gleich wie schon in den VorgÃ¤ngern, wird aber durch neue BewegungsmÃ¶glichkeiten und Plasmide nicht langweilig.
Man kann nur 2 Waffen tragen, jede hat 4 Upgrades, die man mit Geld kaufen kann. (E gedrÃ¼ckt halten, Ã¶ffnet das WaffenmenÃ¼, wie mir Burial at sea nun begebracht hat)
Bei den Vigors (=Plasmide) gibt es jeweils 2 Upgrades, hier kann man stets alle ausrÃ¼sten (Q gedrÃ¼ckt halten!).
Die Tonika sind hier in Form von AusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nden wieder dabei, hier ist die Anzahl auf 4 beschrÃ¤nkt.
Auch gibt es fÃ¼r die einzelnen Abschnitte Charaktere, die eine Verbindung zur Hauptfigur aufbauen, so wie es schon in Teil 1+2 der Fall war, wodurch die Welt wirklich Bedeutung erhÃ¤lt. Sei es ein alter Freund aus MilitÃ¤rzeiten, die Rebellen der Vox Populi oder der allgegenwÃ¤rtige Prophet mit seinen Schergen.
Auch die bioshocktypischen Audiologs sind zurÃ¼ck, damit die Story mehr Tiefe erhÃ¤lt.
Zuletzt hat mich Songbird mit seiner Beziehung zu Elizabeth stark an die Big Daddy/Little Sister Verbindung erinnert.

4. Die Musik im Spiel ist sehr gut gewÃ¤hlt und trÃ¤gt zur AtmosphÃ¤re der Abschnitte bei.
AuÃŸerdem lohnt es sich die Credits zu schauen, da dort der fantastischen Song, dem man im Spiel nur kurz angeteast finden kann, komplett drinnen ist.

AbschlieÃŸend kann ich das Spiel bzw. die ganze Collection allen Leuten empfehlen, die minimal etwas mit Shootern anfangen kÃ¶nnen und viel Wert auf eine tolle Story legen. Would you kindly play it?
That ending was mindblowing, god damn!

This was my first game in the Bioshock universe, and I loved every second of it. It's a fantastic story told through its visuals and environment. Really cool ending too. I was immediately sucked into the game from the moment I started it. When anyone asks me for a recommendation for a good single player FPS, this game is always on my recommendation lists.

Slightly confusing, yet a great adventure nonetheless. Beautiful graphics even for 2021, great combat, and the world building is fantastic. Strongly recommend this single player shooter.

Bioshock Infinite is the proper sequel we should've gotten than Bioshock 2.  Adding a variety of New [strike] Plasmids [/strike] Vigors and weapons along with a new skyhook mechanic that brings a breath of fresh air to the FPS genre.  However they did remove the weapon wheel to where you can only carry two guns but miraculously pick up an enemy's gun and it will have all the upgrades you bought for the previous one.  They do bring back the weapon wheel in the Burial at sea, which is for another review.  How does Bioshock Infinite hold up compared to Bioshock?  I must say again it's great!  Though I am quite tired of the plot twist and turns it does make you think and I will admit after beating this game I would like to question just how it all worked.  The ending doesn't leave any loose ends and it just feels good to finish it.  I was a little bummed though when I only had 7 hours after beating in.  11 with all the DLC and I played this all weekend.  I was expecting at least 20 hours from all the content.  I wouldn't say I had a hard time recommending this especially because I love Bioshock, so if you played Bioshock one or want to play this first (It takes place before Bioshock FYI)  I say give a shot and shoot some Racist!

Good gameplay
Good looks
Good characters and great intractions
Good twist on bioshock formula
Bad story becoming even more flawed the more one thinks of the big picture
But there is more than enough goodies to not play it for the story :3

Nothing in this world is flawless, and anything could be nitpicked.
Bioshock Infinite was and still is awesome, Themes, characters, the world design and the gameplay - at my opinion, everything is superb. 

I'd even say a mad thing: I like it even more than the original Bioshock. To top that: maybe I was too late to System Shock 2 party, and I would admit that it has it's own charm and things that still don't feel outdated - but I don't find it superior to Bioshock Inifinite as well.

Historia muy interesante y buena jugabilidad

A very, very good game if you are into story-focused games. Just as in the previous installments of this series the atmosphere and world-building is superb. Graphics are nice as well. Gameplay is ok, the fights get repetetive if you do not want to experiment with different kinds of vigors. I highly recommend getting the DLCs as well, they add important bits to the story.

Ein wunderbares Spiel Ã¼ber die Thematik von Zeit und Raum!

Die Story ist wohl das umfangreichste was zu erwÃ¤hnen wÃ¤re. Anfangs ist es klar und eintÃ¶nig, wÃ¤hrend im Spielverlauf immer mehr zu Tage rÃ¼ckt und man am Ende einen vÃ¶lligen Brainf**k erlebt. Ein wunderschÃ¶ner Ort dient als Spielwiese, welcher sogar innerhalb dieser Welt logisch erklÃ¤rt ist, interessante Erfindungen und Geschichtsaspekte. Auch die Charaktere, sowohl Haupt- als auch Nebencharaktere sind liebevoll gestaltet und besitzen alle eine tiefere Agenda.

Zur Grafik muss man wohl nichts sagen, ist halt schÃ¶n, vor allem fÃ¼r Comicartliebhaber. Das Spielprinzip ist simpel: Laufen, springen, sammeln, SchieÃŸen. Die vielen Waffen und FÃ¤higkeiten, in Kombination mit den AusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nden und den erwerbbaren Upgrades, erlauben dann aber doch eine freie Entfaltung im Spielstil. Bist du eher der NahkÃ¤mpfer und haust den Leuten mit Elementarschaden auf die Glocke oder betÃ¤ubst du sie und schieÃŸt sie aus sicherer Entfernung vom Rand? Egal, lass laufen und/oder kombiniere.

Als Tipp: FÃ¼r dieses Game gibt es oft Sales, wo man gar nichts mehr falsch machen kann.

M A S T E R P I E C E !

I finished this in 2021, i was alaways scheptical about it should i buy it and start playing it. First 20 minutes, i was like meh its not my type. But man more u play, the more enjoyable the game is Absolutly MindBlowing game. With mindblown story, i cant add more just buy it and play it <3

La verdad que este juego es sencillamente una obra de arte, tanto narrativa como grÃ¡ficamente. 8 aÃ±os despuÃ©s de su lanzamiento, sigue mÃ¡s vigente que nunca. La verdad yo ya lo habÃ­a jugado hace varios aÃ±os, pero ahora decidÃ­ jugar la trilogÃ­a completa y sus expansiones y sinceramente me dio una visiÃ³n mucho mÃ¡s amplia de la historia de la saga y pude entender cosas que habÃ­a pasado por alto la Ãºltima vez que lo juguÃ©.
Recomiendo encarecidamente que jueguen las 2 expansiones llamadas "Burial at Sea", ya que nos van a contestar varias preguntas.
Lo que no me gustÃ³ demasiado: creo que el sistema de armas estÃ¡ mal diseÃ±ado, si bien el poder llevar solo 2 armas le suma bastante desafÃ­o, nunca sabemos bien cual arma elegir, lo que hace que terminemos siempre usando las mismas armas.
Otro punto en el que peca, es que a mÃ­ me encanta explorar y tratar de conseguir todos los Ã­tems "coleccionables" como son en este caso los voxaphone, pero el juego al no disponer de un mapa, complica un poco el tema de encontrar algunos lugares y si bien soy un explorador que trata de recorrer cada rincÃ³n antes de abandonar una zona, en ninguna de mis 2 gameplays pude encontrarlos todos.
Bueno, sin mÃ¡s, es un juegazo.
10/10
Hands down. one of the best story-rich games I've ever played. Definitely a must play!

beautiful looking game, 
fun to play and really enjoyed it, 
wish there was more
would recommend
The bioshock collection is one of the best purchases I made in my life

Good FPS, bad Bioshock game
EDIT 0:
I just noticed I finished game in around 12 hours, that is way too short for this price tag, hence I change my review to negative
EDIT 1:
Clash at the Clouds sucks and is not as fun as you would think it would be
EDIT 2:
Burial at Sea part 1 is also really really short and feels like nostalgia fangrab
EDIT 3:
Elizabeth knew what was behind all the doors, but never learned how to balance gameplay and story elements. Burial at Sea pt2 has shamefully low ammount of actual gameplay and is cutscene-heavy a bit too much for my taste
